post.title: Startup Spotlight: Flick
post.excerpt: The company, backed by Techstars, wants Africans to make easier and faster payments from a single platform.
post.content:
Flick is a fintech startup founded by Ruth Olojede. It is a finance and payment app that aims to make digital payments more accessible to everyone in Africa. The app acts like a personal financial assistant that allows users to keep track of their spending, monitor their net worth, and make contactless payments with any bank or financial provider. Flick is proud to have over 20,000 bank integrations, has processed over $2 million in transactions, and has created unique financial experiences for more than 72,000 users. Its aim is to simplify users’ financial lives and help them manage their money with ease.

In addition to personal financial management, Flick also provides open banking and payment infrastructure in Africa for businesses and developers to integrate payments, access financial data, and deploy financial products through a user-friendly integration. Its solutions simplify money collection through Direct Pay, Card Payments, and Bank Transfers. Flick enables money transfers with Payout products, provides financial data access, KYC management, liveness verification, and fraud reduction. The company, backed by Techstars, wants Africans to make easier and faster payments from a single platform.

node.title: Rose-Margaret Ekeng-Itua has become the first black woman to hold a PhD in Cybernetics
node.excerpt: An award-winning Nigerian Professor, Rose-Margaret Ekeng-Itua, has emerged as the first black woman in the world to earn a doctorate (PhD) in Cybernetics, which is the scientific study of control and communication in animals and machines, concerned with understanding complex systems like learning, cognition, adaptation, emergence, communication, and efficiency. node.title: Tech Sales vs Business Development
node.excerpt: Tech sales and Business development are important for generating revenue for companies in the tech industry.
